column2: Hey, wouldn't be cool if our duck and chick had a little baby? We could\ncall it Chuck."
Or... Dick.'
(entering) Hey.'
Hey.'
Listen, I-I need a favor. Umm, I was in the shower, and as I was cleansing\nmyself, I ah, I-I, well I felt something.'
Was it like a sneeze only better?'
No, no, I mean, I mean a thing on my body.'
(with a disgusted look) What was it?'
Well, I don't know, it's-it's kinda in a place that's not... It's not\nvisually accessible to me, and I was hoping maybe you guys could-could help me out.\n(starts to take off his pants)"
Whoa!!!'
No!!'
Come on you guys, it's no big deal! (He turns around and shows him his\nthing.)"
Whoa-heeeiiiiii-iiiii-ah!! (sees it) Huh.'
Well what is it? Is it a mole? (He moves closer to them, and they jump\nback.)'
No, it's too wrinkly to be a mole."
Well, eww. What? Is it a pimple?'
No, it's... fancier than a pimple. Look Ross, why don't you just go\nsee a\xc2\x85 "
(entering, interrupting them) Hey guys! What's... (sees what they're\ndoing and stops, the guys are stunned)"
Okay, well, it's definite, two more weeks of winter."
Ahhh.'
Yeah, right.'
(to her date) Okay, and then this is the coffee house. This is where I\nplay my music. (points to the stage)'
Good deal.'
Yeah, and these are my friends. People. This is Vince, Vince the people.'
Hi!'
Hey!'
Hey!'
Vince is a fireman.'
Wow! Have you ever rescued anyone from a burning building before?'
98 hot saves, highest in the force.'
Well, y'know if Joey and I played with matches we could get you up to\nan even hundred. "
(dead serious) Fire safety is not a joke, son.'
You're right, I know."
(to Phoebe) Look, I gotta go. I'm on call tonight. (kisses her) See you\nSaturday. (leaves)"
Okay. (watches him leave)'
Wow, he's cute, Pheebs! But I thought you just started dating that\nKindergarten teacher."
Oh, Jason? Yeah, uh-huh, we're seeing each other tonight."
What-Pheebs?! Two dates in one day? That's so unlike you."
I know, I know! I'm like playing the field. Y'know? Like, juggling two\nguys, I'm sowing my wild oats. Y'know? Y'know, this kind've like y'know oat-sowin',\nfield-playin' juggler."
So Pheebs, do they know about each other?'
Does a dog's lips move when he reads? (Joey makes an `I don't know'\nface, and looks to Chandler and Rachel, who're also stumped) Okay, no they don't."
(entering) Hey guys!'
Hey.'
Hi!'
(going over to him) Well?!'
(joining them) Okay, how'd it go at the doctor's?"
Well, he said there's definitely nothing to worry about, it's totally\nbenign."
Well what is it?!'
He couldn't even tell me! He said it was just some sort of skin...\nabnormality. And the worst thing is he-he-he said, he said, without being able to identify\nit, he was reluctant to remove it."

Y'know what? You should go to my guy, because when I went in there\nwith my third nipple. He just lopped it right off. Y'know? So I guess I'm lucky. I mean\nnot as lucky as people who were born with two nipples."
At least they knew what yours was. Y'know, yours had a name."
Oh! Maybe they\'ll name yours after you! Y\'know, they\'ll call it, The Ross.\nAnd then people would be like, "Awww, he\'s got a Ross."'
(sarcastic) Yeah, that'd be cool!"
Pete's breaking up with me."
What?!'
I just checked my messages, and he said that when he gets back from\nAtlanta, we need to talk.'
And?'
Well that's it. People never say `We need to talk' unless it's something\nbad."
Whoa, that doesn't necessarily mean that he's breaking up with you."
Really?!'
Yeah, maybe he just cheated on you.'
...and I know I'll never miss doing it, but I gotta tell you, it's pretty\ncool knowing that you're making a difference in a kid's life."
That is so great! Oh, I... (sees that a parked car near them has caught\non fire) Oh my God!'
Whoa!'
(the fire has worsened) Oh my God!!!'
Ahh-ahh, we'd better call the fire department!"
(stopping him) No! No! '
No, no?'
Well, we don't n-n-n-n-need a fireman, we'd, we'd like a good mechanic.\n(hears the sound of approaching sirens) Oh my God, here they come! Well, we gotta get out\nof here!"
W-w-w-wait! Why?!'
Well look, if I wanted to see a fireman, I would date one. Okay? (she\ndrags him away)'
Th-th-that's all it is, a third nipple. Y'know? Just your run-of-the-mill\nthird nipple. Y'know? You can take it off. Just slice that baby right off!"
Take your shirt off, and let's see what we're dealing with here.\n(Ross starts to take off his pants) What are you doing?"
Just showing you my run-of-the-mill-slice-it-right-off third nipple.'
Well that's not a third nipple."
No?'
First of all, it's on your ass."
Well then, what is it?!'
Wait a minute, hold it. (He goes to the door and opens it.) Johnson!\nWill you come in here a moment?'
I'm with Hamilton!"
He's good with rear things, bring him in too."
(starting to get up) I gotta go water Pete's plants. (stops) Y'know\nwhat, if he's gonna break up with me, maybe I won't water his plants."
Well, if he's gonna break up with you, maybe Joey and I should water\nhis plants. If y'know what I mean."
Or ha-ha, we could go over there and pee on them.'
(entering with Rachel) \xc2\x85and I-I can't take it! Y'know? I'm just,\nalways afraid one of them is gonna catch me with the other one. It's making me crazy."
Well honey, then why don't you break up with one of them?"
(disgusted) Uh.'
Whoa-whoa-whoa. What ah, what happened to playing the field?'
Well, it just, it doesn't feel like playing anymore, it feels like work.\nIt's like I'm working in the field."
So Pheebs, pick one of them.'
Yeah. Which one do you like more?'
Well, Vince is great, y'know `cause, he's like a guy, guy. Y'know? He's\nso burly, he's sooo very burly. (giggles)"
Okay, good, so there you go. Go with Vince.'
Yeah, but Jason's really sensitive."
Well sensitive is important, pick him.'
Yeah.'
Oh sure, go with the sissy.'
Jason is not a sissy!'
Oh no-no-no-no, I meant Chandler.'
Y'know I have dinner plans!!"
Thank you soo much for coming on such a short notice. Ladies and\ngentlemen, I've-I've-I've been practicing medicine for twenty-three years, and I'm\nstumped. "
Whoa. (they all lean in to get a closer look, Ross isn't pleased)"

Okay, this is the den. All right, check this out. Lights! (the lights\nturn on automatically, but are very bright) Whoa! All right. Less lights! Bad lights!\nLights go away! (they dim) Oh, see you just need to find the right command.'
Yes, and the dimmer switch.'
Whoa! For a rich guy he's got, that's a pretty small TV."
No-no-no, that's a video-phone. But hey guys you're not supposed to be\nhere, so please, do not touch anything."
(sitting down on the couch) I-kea! This is comfortable.'
(entering with Phoebe) This place is amazing.'
God, that is the nicest kitchen.'
I know.'
No! But it's the nicest kitchen, the refrigerator told me to have a\ngreat day."
Look at this! A millionaire's checkbook."
Joey, put that down! (the phone rings) Oh my God! It's Pete. Okay, get\nout!! How the hell do you answer a video-phone! (steps in front of it, and automatically\nanswers it)"
Monica? (the gang ducks and hides)'
I guess that's how."
Hey Monica, how's it going."
Oh it\xc2\x92s umm, good! It's umm, it\xc2\x92s good, just here watering the\nplants."
Well don't forget that fiches over there by Rachel."
(standing up) Ahh... Chandler's on the couch!!"
I see him, you guys are just the worst hiders ever.'
(standing up) Hey Pete.'
Hi, how ya doing?'
Ahh, Pete, the other day when you said you needed to talk, umm, just so\nI know, is it good news or bad news.'
Oh, it's good news. No, it's definitely good news. Hold on a second, I\nhave another call. (clicks his remote) (to his other call) Hey, how's it going?"
Oh no-no-no, it's still me."
Ah, no it's not. I've got picture-in-picture here. (to other caller) Yeah.\n(listens) Yeah, okay. I'm gonna have to call you back later. (pause) Monica? You. I'm\ngonna have to call you back."
Oh, oh, okay umm, so I'll see you soon."
Okay, I love you.'
I love you.'
I love you, love you.'
Okay. Well, it's good news. It's good news."
So, what do you thing the good news is?'
(looking at the checkbook) Wow! Look at this! He wrote a check for 50,000\ndollars to Hugo Ligrens Ring Design. (Monica is stunned) Oh, sorry, what do you think the\ngood news is?'
Oh my.'
Monica's gonna marry a millionaire!!!"
Hey, you gotta get Mom on the phone. Call Mom! Call Mom!'
Hello."
And that's Pete's Mom. "

Mon you definitely have to make it a theme wedding, and the theme could
be, \xc2\x93Look how much money we\xc2\x92ve got!\xc2\x94 Y'know, I mean you could put, you
could put money in-in the invitations! You-you could have like little money place
settings. And ah, you could start with a money salad! I mean it\xc2\x92ll be dry, but people
will like it."
Would you stop? We\xc2\x92ve only been going out a couple of weeks, I mean\nwe don\xc2\x92t even know if he\xc2\x92s gonna propose.'
Yes, but this is Pete. Okay? He\xc2\x92s not like other people, on your\nfirst date he took you to Rome. For most guys that\xc2\x92s like a third or fourth date\nkinda thing.'
Well if-if that\xc2\x92s what it is, then it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s crazy.'
Monica\xc2\x92s right. We\xc2\x92re talking about getting married here. Okay?\nShe-she can\xc2\x92t just rush into this.'
Oh please, what do you know! You married a lesbian!'
All right. I gotta go. I have break up with Vince.'
Oh, so you\xc2\x92re going with the teacher, huh?'

Yeah, I like Vince a lot, y'know? But, it\xc2\x92s just Jason\xc2\x92s so
sensitive, y'know? And in the long run, I think sensitive it\xc2\x92s just better than
having just like a really, really, really nice (pause) butt. (Her eyes glaze over thinking
about the butt.) (pause) Jason! Definitely Jason! Okay, wish me luck!"
Good luck!'
OH MY GOD!!! (She holds her hands up in triumph and the gang all look at\nher.) Sorry, I was just imagining what it\xc2\x92d be like to catch the money bouquet. '
Excuse me. Umm, is Vince here?'
Oh sure. Vince?!'
Yo!! (slides down that pole that fire station\xc2\x92s have)'
Wow! I didn\xc2\x92t know you guys actually used those. '
So, what\xc2\x92s up?'
Umm, wow. This-this isn\xc2\x92t gonna be easy. Umm, I don\xc2\x92t think we\nshould see each other anymore.'
Uh-huh. G-good deal.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry.'

No-no it\xc2\x92s okay. It\xc2\x92s just that ah, I thought we had something
pretty special here. And y'know I-I felt like you were someone I could finally open up to,
and\xc2\x85 (starts choking up) That there\xc2\x92s so much in me I have to share with you
yet."
Oh my God, I didn\xc2\x92t\xc2\x85'
(starting to cry) I\xc2\x92m sorry, I can\xc2\x92t talk. I\xc2\x92m gonna go\nwrite in my journal. (walks away)'
(running after him) Wait-wait-wait! Wait!!'
(to Ross) I\xc2\x92m telling you, if you want to take care of that thing,\nyou should go to my herbal guy.'
Thank you, but I want to remove it Pheebs. I don\xc2\x92t want to make it\nsavory.'
Y'know when girls sleep with guys with weird things on their body, they\ntell their friends about it."
Gimme this. (Grabs the herbalist\xc2\x92s card and leaves.)'
(entering) Hi! Okay, don\xc2\x92t be mad at me, but I couldn\xc2\x92t\nresist.'
Brides magazines?'
Yes, and I know that you\xc2\x92d say no if he asked you, but I\xc2\x92m\nsorry; how great would you look walking down the aisle in this Donna Carin. (shows her the\npicture.)'
(gasps) Oh, you so would! Oh, you should get that anyway. (They both\nlook at her.) Like for clubbing. '

It is so weird, I know what I said, but uh, this morning, I was lying in
bed I was, I was imagining what it would be like to say yes. (Rachel slams the magazine
shut in amazement.) I know it\xc2\x92s a little sudden, and it\xc2\x92s a little rushed, and
it\xc2\x92s totally not like me to do something like this, but that doesn\xc2\x92t mean I
can\xc2\x92t. Right? I mean I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m crazy about Pete, and I know that we want the
same things, and when I thought about saying yes, it made me really happy.'
Oh my God. (starting to cry) '
I know. (pause) I need more pie. (goes and gets some)'
Hey Mon umm, if you do get married, can I bring two guests?'
You didn\xc2\x92t break up with that fireman?'
No, that was my way of telling you. Well, it turns out he\xc2\x92s\nincredibly sensitive, he keeps a journal and he paints. He even showed me charcoal\ndrawings that he drew of me.'
Wow!'
Yeah, well he\xc2\x92d prefer water colors, but y'know, he has easy access\nto a lot of charcoal."
So then, are you going to dump Jason?'

Well, yeah, because I have to break up with someone, and\xc2\x85 Okay so
Jason is sensitive, (holds up one finger) but now so\xc2\x92s Vince (holds up one finger on
her other hand) Plus, Vince has the body y'know? (holds up two more fingers on the Vince
side) So\xc2\x85 It\xc2\x92s really just about the math."
(knocks on the door) Jason?'
Yeah, come on in.'
So Phoebe, you ah, sounded kinda serious on the phone, is ah, is anything\nwrong?'
Nah-ha!'
You must be Ross.'
Hi.'
I am Guru Saj. (takes the drawer back and replaces)'
Listen, I got to tell you I\xc2\x92ve-I\xc2\x92ve never been to a guru before,\nso...'

Well, relax. If it makes you feel better, I\xc2\x92ve attended some of
the finest medical schools in Central America. Well then, let\xc2\x92s take a look at this

huh. As I suspected, it\xc2\x92s a koondis!'
What\xc2\x92s a koondis?'

I don\xc2\x92t know, what\xc2\x92s a koondis with you? (starts laughing as\nif that joke was funny, Ross only looks at him, and he stops) Please, lie down! I\xc2\x92ve\ngot a sav that oughta shrink that right up.'
I guess it\xc2\x92s worth a try.'
Oh sure, we should see results\xc2\x97Whoa!! Clearly not the way to go!!\n(quickly wipes it off)'
What?! What?!'
We appear to have angered it.'
We?! We angered it?!'
Oh, I think I see the problem. And I\xc2\x92m afraid we\xc2\x92re gonna\nhave to use a much stronger tool. (Ross gives him a \xc2\x91What?\xc2\x92 look) Love.'
Oh God!'
(He starts moving his hands around in circles above the thing.) Ross,\nthere is absolutely no way this is going to come off unless you start to\xc2\x85'
Ow!! '
Oops.'
What was, what was that?'
Well it\xc2\x92s gone.'
What?! How\xc2\x92s that?'
It got caught on my watch.'
Hey! (congratulates him)'
Lights. (The lights turn on, once again they\xc2\x92re too bright.) Uh,\nromantic lights. (The lights dim.)'
Ooh, nice.'
So ah, there was this thing I wanted to talk to you about.'
Oh, right! I completely forgot about that.'
Well ah, I\xc2\x92ve been doing a lot of thinking, and I look at my\nlife\xc2\x85'
Yeah?'
And I feel like I\xc2\x92ve conquered the business world, and I feel like\nI\xc2\x92ve conquered the intellectual world, and now I-I have the most beautiful woman in\nthe world.'
Wow.'
There\xc2\x92s one thing missing.'
What\xc2\x92s that?'
It\xc2\x92s time for me to conquer the physical world.'
Okay. (not sure of herself)'
Monica, I want to become (pause) the Ultimate Fighting Champion.'
You wanna what?!'
I want to become the Ultimate Fighting Champion! It\xc2\x92s the most\nintense physical competition in the world, it\xc2\x92s banned in 49 states!'
What are you talking about?'
Okay, my trainer, Ho Chi, is teaching me a combination of Gee Koon Doe and\nBrazilian street fighting, I\xc2\x92ve even had my own octagon training ring designed.'
And I suppose you used a ring designer for that.'
Yeah. Monica, I want you there in the front row when I win. I want you\nclose enough to smell the blood. What do you think?'
My parents will be so happy.'

(singing) \xc2\x93Crazy underwear, creepin\xc2\x92 up my butt. (Jason

after the show.'
(going up to her) Hey. I was\xc2\x85'
Hey!'
I was passin\xc2\x92 by and I saw that you were playing tonight, it\xc2\x92s\nkinda cool seeing you up there. (kisses her)'

I don\xc2\x92t know, he just started kissing me. Get him! Get him, Vince!'

just, I\xc2\x92m terrible, I\xc2\x92m a terrible person. I\xc2\x92m terrible."
Phoebe, Phoebe relax, it\xc2\x92s okay. I mean we never said this was\nexclusive.'
Yeah, and neither did we. Give yourself a break.'
Really?!'
Yeah. I mean y'know, we haven\xc2\x92t been going out that long.\nCome on, we haven\xc2\x92t even slept together yet. Huh."
You haven\xc2\x92t?'
You have?'
Well, this is none of my business. (starts to walk away)'
(to Phoebe) I-I can\xc2\x92t believe this! You-you\xc2\x92ve slept with him?!'
Well, I made you a candle light dinner in the park.'
Y'know Phoebe, I\xc2\x92m gonna make this real easy for you. (walks out)"
(to Vince) Well, that could\xc2\x92ve been really awkward.'
You made him a candle light dinner in the park?'
Yeah, but I-I-I-I can do that for you, I\xc2\x92m gonna do that for you.'
Uh yeah, I can\xc2\x92t believe I ever went out with somebody who would\nactually have an open flame in the middle of a wooden area. (walks out)'
(comforting the duck) Everything\xc2\x92s gonna be all right. Okay,\nDick?'
(entering) Hello, I am Guru Saj-(sees the duck)-Whoa!! (to Joey)\nThat\xc2\x92s supposed to be a duck right? \xc2\x91Cause otherwise, this is waaay out of my\nleague.'
Yeah, yeah. He\xc2\x92s got a, he\xc2\x92s got a really bad cough, and our\nvet, he can\xc2\x92t do anything about it. Is there something you can do?'
Hmm, let me see. Let me see. Do you think you could get him to eat a\nbat?'
